Attribute.Name: title
Attribute.Value: Introduction to Computer Programming for Scientists and Engineers

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Value: E77 is an introductory course on computer programming for lower-division students in science and engineering. The principal goal of the course is to teach basic computer pro- gramming concepts and apply them to computer-based problem-solving methods. The course stresses hands-on computer programming using MATLAB, a powerful high-level programming environment. Website contains lecture slides and Matlab exercises. Course is taught at the University of California at Berkeley.
